Shape: Objects have different shapes that can help identify them. For example, a round ball can be distinguished from a square block.
Size: Objects have different sizes that can help differentiate them. For example, a small pen can be distinguished from a large book.
Sound: Objects make different sounds when they are moved or interacted with. For example, a squeaky toy can be distinguished from a clinking metal object.
Smell: Objects have different smells that can help identify them. For example, a lemon can be distinguished from a banana.
Taste: Objects have different tastes that can help identify them. For example, a sweet candy can be distinguished from a sour lemon.
